result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Nadine L Brown in court with attorney Joshua Hargrove.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.
BTC:   Finding of good cause to waive time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Joshua Hargrove
Faxed to ZCI

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  Conditions:  You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 4:00 p.m.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance. THE EXCEPTION IS PRESCRIPTION MEDICATION. IT IS AN ORDER OF THE COURT THAT THE DEFENDANT NOT CONSUME OR POSSESS ANY OPIATES/PAIN MEDICAITONS, INCLUDING OXYCODONE.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Preliminary hearing at 01-28-2016 08:30 am

Defendant Nadine L Brown in court with attorney Robert William Keller.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set. Defense also files motion to withdraw in 15CF1286
The State asks for $5,000.00 cash. Defense does not feel a cash bond is necessary in this instance.

On both cases, defense asks the Court to withdraw.

BTC: Bond to be set at $2,500.00 signature bond. Same terms and conditions as previous bond; specifically may not have oxycodone. Mr. Keller may withdraw. SPD to reappoint.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.
